result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Failure to Install Ignition Interlock Device

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew J Loeser

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 21, 2022 at 11:30 am.

(Cases 19CF970, 19CF1228, 19CF1521, 22CF693 are called at 9:56 AM) No appearance by Defendant Andrew J Loeser.  Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court for Andrew J Loeser.  Attorney Trenton Piltz in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court notes this case was to be called at 9:30 AM and the Defendant was in Court at that time. State has no objection to rescheduling. 
Status Conference: 12/21/2022 at 11:30 AM.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.

8:44 AM Cases called 19CF970, 19CF1228, 19CF1521 & 22CF693. Defendant Andrew J Loeser in court. Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court for Andrew J Loeser.  Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for State of Wisconsin. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. These cases were administratively transferred to Judge Barna. Jury Trials in 19CF1521 and 19CF1228 are removed from the calendar. All cases are to be rescheduled with Judge Barna.
Status conference on August 17, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Cases called at 8:52 AM: 19CF970, 19CF1228, 19CF1521, 22CF693.
Defendant Andrew J Loeser in court with Attorney Roger M Hillestad.  Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Counsel notes the Jury Trial scheduled for 8/8/22-8/10/22 will need to be rescheduled per the Court's request. Court orders the trial removed from the calendar.
Trial set for September to remain on the calendar.
STC: 8/17/22 at 8:45 PM.

(2:20 PM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Andrew J Loeser appeared by phone without counsel.
State notes the defendant has not waived time limits and the defendant is represented by Attorney Hillestad in other matters but is not appointed on this case.
Defendant advises would like Attorney Hillestad to represent on this case as well.
Defendant advises would like to reschedule this to have time to speak with Attorney Hillestad.
Defendant waives time limits for preliminary hearing.
Court orders the defendant to contact the State Public Defender's Office to have Attorney Hillestad appointed to this case too.
Hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 8:45 am in Branch 4 to ride with defendant's other cases.

(Case called at 11:36 AM)
Defendant Andrew Loeser appears without counsel.  Attorney Afton Lewis appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives reading of the Complaint.  
Preliminary hearing: 7/19/2022 at 2:00 PM
